title: Compliance
content:
On the Compliance page, you can view the license compliance status of on-premises and SaaS products. SAM calculates license compliance based on the current software and hardware information in Universal Discovery and CMDB (UD/UCMDB).

For some products, you might want the compliance report to reflect the product compliance information within a certain period. Currently, SAM doesn't support such scenarios. 

Dashboard

View the license compliance position by publisher

The Dashboard tab page presents you the license compliance position of all on-premises or SaaS products by publisher. You can view how many products of a certain vendor are compliant, how much money you have overspent on purchasing licenses for this publisher's products, and the estimated cost that you need to spend to cover the license gap between software installations and license consumptions.

Use the filter widget and search box to find products as needed. For more information on how to use the filter widget, see Filters.

View compliance information of products

To drill down and view the compliance information at the product level, click a publisher summary card. By default, this page lists all that publisher's products that are managed and available in your production environment. For SaaS products, a SaaS banner is attached at the top of the card.

If you click Clear all to remove the filters, the Product.Publisher filter remains and you can still view the products developed by the specified publisher.

At the product level, each card summarizes the basic product information, including the product name, the publisher, and the date when the product data is last synchronized:

On-premises products

Field Description
Status Indicates the product compliance status. The values can be Compliant or Noncompliant.
Estimated cost

Indicates the estimated cost calculated based on the license gap between software installations and consumed licenses.

To have the cost value, make sure you have configured the Count per pack, Pack price, and Currency fields on the License Models page. For details, see Edit a license model.

  • If the cost value is greater than zero, the product is compliant. This means some product versions have surplus licenses.
  • If the cost value is less than zero, the product is noncompliant. This means at least one software installation isn't covered by the corresponding license or a higher version license.
  • If the cost value is zero, the number of product licenses equals that of software installations.
Number of versions

Indicates the number of product versions deployed in the production environment.

Note: For Oracle Database (Based on LMS) instances, the value by default includes Oracle Database running instances and all Oracle Database Options and Management Packs.

SaaS products

Field Description
Status Indicates the product compliance status. The values can be Compliant or Noncompliant.
Total cost

Total cost for purchasing product licenses.

View compliance information of product versions

Click a card to drill down to the consumption details at the product version level, where you can see the following fields on each displayed card:

Field Applicable licensing type Description
Metric (italic text below the product name)
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing

Indicates the type of license metric of the product version. You can get the license metric information from the stock keeping unit (SKU) when you purchase a license. A license SKU tells all the properties of a license, including the product, version, and lifecycle.

Make sure you define the correct license metric for the license model and use the corresponding license rule with the same license metric. Otherwise, SAM will calculate license consumption based on different license metrics. As a result, you will see multiple cards for each license metric.
Balance
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing

Indicates the gap between license points available and license points consumed.

Note: For freeware product versions, this field has no impact on the product’s compliance calculation.
Total entitlements
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing

Indicates the number of effective licenses available in the license pool, which is calculated based on the Purchased entitlements, Purchased upgrade entitlements​, and Entitlements from lower versions.

To have the license pool information, make sure you have configured the License metric and Product version fields on the License Models page. For details, see Edit a license model.

Consumed entitlements

 Device-based licensing

Indicates the number of license rights consumed by software installations.

The installations might include many versions depending on the built-in license compatibility matrix. (In this release, SAM doesn't support customizing the compatibility matrix in this release.) For example, a product license of a higher version can entitle the software installations of lower versions.
Assigned entitlements User-based licensing Indicates the total number of license points that the users are authorized to use.
Consumed entitlements User-based licensing Indicates the number of license points that are entitled to and have been consumed by the users.
Unassigned entitlements consumed User-based licensing Indicates the total number of license points that are consumed by users who aren't authorized to use these licenses.
Estimated cost
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing

Indicates the estimated cost calculated based on the license gap.

To have the cost value, make sure you have configured the Count per pack, Pack price, and Currency fields on the License Models page. For details, see Edit a license model.

  • If the cost value is greater than zero, the number of licenses available is greater than that of actual installations.
  • If the cost value is less than zero, some installations aren't covered by the corresponding license or a higher version license.
  • If the cost value is zero, the number of product licenses equals that of software installations.
Commercial model
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing
 Hover over the card to view this field, which specifies whether the product version is commercial, freeware, or has an unknown license type.
Installations covered
  • Device-based licensing
  • User-based licensing
 Hover over the card to view this field, which specifies the total number of installations covered in the license consumption calculation.

Below is a table of License summary of each product version that illustrates the license pool details.

Field Description
Product version The version of the product.
License metric The license metric of the product.
Purchased entitlements The points for purchasing full licenses directly.
Purchased upgrade entitlements

The points that are purchased to access a newer license version on the basis of your base licenses.

Some vendors provide upgrade license SKUs to save costs by upgrading licenses from existing older versions to target versions, which is more cost-efficient than purchasing the full license of the target version directly.
Entitlements from lower versions The increase in the number of license points when a software license is upgraded from a lower version to the current version.
Entitlements consumed by higher versions The decrease in the number of license points when a software license is upgraded to a higher version from the current version.
Total entitlements The number of effective licenses available in the license pool, which is calculated based on the Purchased entitlements​, Purchased upgrade entitlements​, and Entitlements from lower versions.
Consumed entitlements The number of license points consumed by software installations.
Balance​ The gap between Total entitlements and Consumed entitlements.

Notes:

  • In either of the following cases, the value of the Consumed entitlements field is less than or equals to the value of the Total entitlements field:
    • The product version has sufficient licenses to cover its installations.
    • The product version doesn't have enough licenses to cover its installations, but it has borrowed some licenses from higher versions in the downgrade matrix. The installations covered by the borrowed license are reflected in the compliance card of that higher product version. 
    • The product version doesn't have enough licenses to cover its installations and fails to borrow licenses from higher versions in the downgrade matrix. Then, we recommend to purchase licenses of the highest version in the upgrade matrix. The installations that can't be covered will be reflected in the compliance card of the highest product version. 
  • In the following case, the value of the Consumed entitlements field will be greater than the value of the Total entitlements field:

    If a product version can't borrow licenses from higher product versions in the downgrade matrix and itself is the highest product version in the upgrade matrix, SAM calculates the license gap based on the highest product version in the upgrade matrix. This is also true when the product version is an isolated node in either the upgrade matrix or downgrade matrix (that is, no upgrade or downgrade relationship is configured for this product version). 

View compliance information per licensing type

Click a card to drill down to the consumption summary of the selected product version. The information you see depends on the licensing type of the products. For SaaS products, you will see the subscription details.

Device-based licensing

For device-based licensing, you will see information including the following:

Field Description
Name The display name of the device.
Model The model of the device.
Commercial model Specifies whether the product version is commercial, freeware, or has an unknown license type.
Number of processors The number of processors.
Cores per processor The number of cores per processor.
Factor value Some products such as SQL Server and Oracle have factor values that will affect the final license calculation. An empty field indicates that the product doesn't use the factor.
Consumed entitlements The number of license rights consumed by this product.
Allocated entitlements

Allocate license to the device in a random way. If the field is populated, it means the device has been covered by licenses. An empty field indicates that no additional licenses can cover the device.

If you have licenses that link to the license model for the product, that is, you have set the License metric and Product version fields in Edit a license model, SAM will assign licenses to this device in a random way. For more information about how SAM calculates license consumption for on-premises products, see Calculate license consumption.
Description

A short description of compliance calculation.

User-based licensing

For user-based licensing, you will see information including the following:

Field Description
User

The user who has installed the product.

<N/A>: Indicates that SAM can't find the user information. This is either because the device information hasn't been synchronized from UD/UCMDB to Service Management,or the product doesn't have a device owner assigned. You can go to Service Asset & Configuration to add the device owner information. For more information, see Edit a device record.
Commercial model Specifies whether the product version is commercial, freeware, or has an unknown license type.
Total entitlements The number of licenses that the user is entitled to use.
Consumed entitlements

The number of consumption points. 

If the user name is <N/A>, this value is the total number of license consumption on all devices that have no device owner assigned. For more information about how to assign an owner to a device, see Edit a device record.
Allocated entitlements

Allocate license to the user in a random way. If the field is populated, it means the user has been covered by licenses. An empty field indicates that no additional licenses can cover the user.

If you have licenses that link to the license model for the product, that is, you have set the License metric and Product version fields in Edit a license model, SAM will assign licenses to this device in a random way. For more information about how SAM calculates license consumption for on-premises products, see Calculate license consumption.
Balance

The gap between the number of licenses assigned and the number of licenses actually consumed.
Description A short description of compliance calculation.

Export a product compliance report

  1. View license consumption information at the product version level.
  2. In the upper-left corner, click Export.
    The PDF file downloaded summarizes information on product compliance.

Archive a product compliance report

  1. View license consumption information at the product version level.

  2. In the upper-left corner, click  Archive to save the PDF report for later use. 

    You can view all archived reports related to a product on the Report history tab of the Products page.

Product compliance

By default, the Product compliance tab page shows a list of products that are managed and available in your production environment, as well as their publisher and compliance information.

You can change the filter to customize your view and download the filtered content by clicking the Export to CSV or Export to XLS button in the More drop-down list. If the specified filter contains both on-premises and SaaS products, you will see two files downloaded, one for on-premises products and the other for SaaS products. The file for on-premises products provides compliance information at both the product and product version levels.

You can delete the calculation records as needed. Note that deleting the latest compliance calculation result of a product will affect the statistics in the compliance reports on the SAM Home page. If the compliance result for a SaaS product is empty, it's either due to the operation errors or you select the wrong scenario for the integration task in the product settings.

Click the product name to view more detailed information. From the General tab, you can see the license compliance information of each product version. For on-premises products, you will see another tab Consumption details, which lists the license consumption data of the product for each device or user, depending on whether the product uses device-based licensing or user-based licensing. For SaaS products, the tab is User entitlement and you can view the entitlement details of the product.

Limitations

During license compliance calculation, SAM:

  • Doesn't support secondary devices for Office and Office Visio
  • Provides only the subscription status for Office 365 (deprecated)
  • Doesn't support the core-based licenses of products utilizing IBM virtualization technologies

Related topics

SAM best practice
